page.title: 14WOODHAM VILLAGE.
page.content: Woodham Village is mostly residential. There are council houses, flats and a private housing estate. Apart from that there is some uncultivated land that isn't even used for cattle. There is a little woodland area called South Agnew Plantation, which is mostly deciduous trees. Woodham Village looks unfinished. The workmen have a lot to do there. There are two shops, one selling food and sweets and the other is a chip shop.The houses are made of brick and are mostly red. People have to travel into Newton Aycliffe for shopping and other facilities. The Equestrian Centre to the east is now closed because of a temporary problem of access. The old woodland areas, bridleways and footpaths have been keptfor the use of the inhabitants. James 1st was thought to have visited Woodham Races!
